column2: SOUTH DAKOTA PRACTICE PERMIT TEST
column6: SD

column2: Question Text
column6: Answer2 Text
column8: Answer3 Text

column2: 1. To enter a gap in traffic while driving on a highway:
column4: check behind, then watch the vehicle ahead.
column6: speed up and let vehicles make way.
column8: watch only the vehicles behind the gap.

column2: 2. When they see a crossbuck sign, drivers:
column4: are legally required to yield the right of way to trains.
column6: must slow down and wait for the red lights to flash.
column8: must always come to a complete stop.

column2: 3. If you meet a stopped school bus with the lights flashing and the signal arm extended, you should:
column6: watch for children and proceed at normal speed.
column8: proceed at 15 MPH or less, if no children are present.

column2: 4. If you are feeling tired while driving, you should:
column6: drink coffee.
column8: open a window.

column2: 5. If a vehicle is coming towards you at night with its high beams on, making it hard to see the road ahead, you should:
column4: look ahead towards the left edge of your lane.
column6: look straight ahead towards the middle of the lane.
column8: look ahead towards the right edge of your lane.

column2: 6. The sign in the picture:
column4: shows the highest speed drivers can travel at the exit of the intersection.
column6: indicates the minimum ramp speed at the highway exit point.
column8: is used to advise motorists of the appropriate ramp speed at the highway exit point.

column2: 7. To make a proper right turn:
column4: slow down and get into the lane nearest the centerline.
column6: give the proper signal and get into the lane nearest the right curb.
column8: swing to the left before turning right.

column2: 8. When the road is slippery, drivers should _________ their following distance.
column6: increase
column8: maintain

column2: 9. What does the pictured signal indicate?
column4: A pedestrian may begin crossing the street.
column6: Pedestrians may turn right.
column8: A pedestrian may not not begin crossing the street.

column2: 10. This road sign means:
column6: You have the right of way
column8: Yield the right-of-way

column2: 11. If you get on a wrong expressway exit, you must:
column4: drive in reverse to return to the expressway.
column6: get off at the next exit and look for signs that tell you how to return to the expressway.
column8: use the the exit ramp to accelerate to expressway speed and blend with traffic.

column2: 12. A school bus ahead of you in your lane is stopped with red lights flashing. You must:
column4: reduce your speed, change lanes and pass.
column6: stop until the lights stop flashing.
column8: stop until all the children have left the bus.

column2: 13. You should never depend on your mirrors when you prepare to change lanes. Why?
column6: Mirrors are useless.
column8: Mirrors leave “blind spots” behind both sides of vehicles.

column2: 14. What type of pavement marking shows you which lane you must use for a turn?
column6: Diamond
column8: Arrows

column2: 15. What is the first thing you should do if your wheels move off the pavement?
column6: Ease your foot off the gas pedal and brake gently.
column8: Pull over to the right and sound your horn to warn the other drivers.

column2: 16. This sign warns drivers of:
column6: a dip in the road. Drivers should be ready to stop if the dip is filled with water.
column8: a bridge ahead, wide enough to accommodate two lanes of traffic, but with very little clearance.

column2: 17. Before entering an intersection, drivers should look:
column6: right, left, then right again.
column8: left, right, then left again.

column2: 18. The following symptoms are associated with drowsy driving:
column6: You don’t remember driving the last few miles.
column8: All of the above.

column2: 19. When driving in fog, drivers should use:
column6: high beam headlights.
column8: parking lights.

column2: 20. Road signs that point out scenic areas and parks are:
column6: brown and white.
column8: green and white.

column2: 21. To drive defensively, you must:
column6: keep one hand on the steering wheel.
column8: keep your eyes moving.

column2: 22. When a pedestrian carrying a white cane is at the corner ready to cross the street in front of you, before making your right turn, you should:
column4: yield the right-of-way and wait until the pedestrian crosses the street.
column6: use your horn to help the pedestrian cross the street.
column8: turn off the ignition until the person crosses the street.

column2: 23. This road sign means:
column4: You must travel at the speed indicated
column6: The maximum speed limit under ideal conditions
column8: None of the above

column2: 24. At intersections with a yield sign, you must:
column6: yield the right-of-way to cross traffic close enough to cause conflict.
column8: yield to the vehicles on your left only.

column2: 25. When changing lanes, you should remember that:
column4: vehicles with two outside mirrors have no blind spots.
column6: You only need to turn and look over your right shoulder for lane changes to the right or left.
column8: you should look over your left shoulder for a left lane change and your right shoulder for a right lane change.
